definition:
Let ${\mathfrak}{g}$ be a semi-simple Lie group, ${\mathfrak}{h}$ a
Cartan subalgebra, $R$ the associated root system, and $R^+\subset R$ a
set of positive roots. We have a root decomposition into the Cartan
subalgebra and the root spaces ${\mathfrak}{g}_\alpha$
$${\mathfrak}{g}={\mathfrak}{h}\oplus\left(\bigoplus_{\alpha\in R}{\mathfrak}{g}_\alpha\right).$$
Now let ${\mathfrak}{b}$ be the direct sum of the Cartan subalgebra and
the positive root spaces.
$${\mathfrak}{b}={\mathfrak}{h}\oplus\left(\bigoplus_{\beta\in R^+}{\mathfrak}{g}_\beta\right).$$
This is called a [*Borel subalgebra*]{}.
